definition: Time points that can act as a time reference, e.g. other time points will have their time reference to this time point.
Label for a time point in the clinical study schedule, can be the same as the type of visit.
Unit Dimension act as a reference to a set of unit definitions where unit conversion is possible.Y
Objective Level
Endpoint Level

A null flavor is an ancillary piece of data that provides additional information when its primary piece of data is null (has a missing value). There is controlled terminology for the null flavor data item which includes such familiar values as Unknown, Other, and Not Applicable among its fourteen terms.

A knowledge field that focuses on research and development of specific treatments for diseases and pathologic findings, as well as prevention of conditions that negatively impact the health of an individual. (NCI)
Type of Treatment
Type of Epoch
Sub Type of Epoch
Visits can span over a number of sub visits each with a specific sub visit label (e.g. Day 1, Day 2, etc.)
Type of criteria (e.g. Inclusion Criteria)
Category of objectives (e.g. Efficacy, Safety, etc.)
Category of endpoints (e.g. Efficacy, Safety, etc.)
Sub category of endpoints (e.g. Continuous, Categorical, Count, etc.)
Categori for criteria (e.g. Demography, Diseases, Lifestyle, etc.)
Sub categori for criteria
Logical operators
Unit Subset act as a grouping of unit definitions within a user scope. This can be across unit dimensions  and a unit definition can be part of multiple subsets.
Mode of contact for a visit (e.g. on site, virtual)
Type of Arm
Type of Element
Sub Type of Element
Compound Dispensed In
Delivery Device
Language on 3 digits based on the ISO639-3
Data type for ODM metadata
Endpoint Sub Level is a sub classification of Endpoint Level
Rule for allocation of study visit to study epochs
Main event in the study schedule where subjects change status or disposition group.
Mode of data collection, e.g. eCOA, paper
Confirmatory Purpose (e.g. to demonstrate or confirm)
Non-confirmatory Purpose (e.g. to compare or investigate)
